image.altText: a group of mostly men and young boys walk around on wet ground

props.synopsis: The Australian government has granted hundreds of temporary visas to Palestinians in the weeks since Israel began its bombing campaign of Gaza, which has killed thousands of civilians and flattened large swathes of the densely populated strip.

title.children: Government grants hundreds of temporary visas to Palestinians

image.altText: A close up of Penny Wong in glasses observing during a press conference.

props.synopsis: Foreign Minister Penny Wong says 67 Australians, permanent residents and their families crossed through the Rafah border crossing overnight. Follow live.

title.children: Wong confirms 67 Australians and family members crossed from Gaza into Egypt overnight

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Looking beyond the temporary ceasefire, what happens when hostilities  resume?
Penny Wong calls temporary ceasefire 'important and necessary'
Start of ceasefire will be announced in next 24 hours: Qatari foreign ministry

image.altText: A poster with the words HOSTAGE DEAL CEASEFIRE is held in the air by an obscured hand

props.synopsis: Israel and Hamas have agreed to a four-day ceasefire in their war in exchange for the release of 50 women and children held in Gaza. Here's what we know about the deal and what may unfold next.

title.children: Israel and Hamas have reached a temporary ceasefire deal after six weeks of fighting. This is what we know about it

image.altText: A horse with a harness coach.

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian police officer who aired concerns about young harness racing employees' long work days was taken off the case after a phone call from the head of the state's peak racing body to a more senior police officer, an email chain reveals.

title.children: Police officer who approached Tasracing boss with concerns after workplace crash 'will not be further involved', email chain reveals

image.altText: The Hutchins School logo, a lion, on a school building with out-of-focus leaves in the foreground

props.synopsis: Peter was in prison when he happened to catch an episode of Australian Story about Grace Tame. When he saw her abuser — Nicolaas Bester — pop up on the screen, he says he "froze".

title.children: 'I saw Grace Tame and then I saw a picture of him': TV episode prompts new abuse claim against Nicolaas Bester

image.altText: A man with a hose fights a fire.

props.synopsis: Firefighters are responding to a bushfire in Perth's southern suburbs that is threatening lives and homes on a sweltering spring day.

title.children: Firefighters respond to bushfire in Perth's south as temperature climbs towards 40C

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann arrives at court, with reporters behind him.

props.synopsis: Ex-Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann testifies in court about the events leading up to the alleged rape of his former colleague Brittany Higgins at Parliament House.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann takes the stand in defamation action against Network Ten, Lisa Wilkinson

image.altText: An elderly woman in a church

props.synopsis: The emails released to state parliament reveal members of Mrs Nowland's family knew the details of how she was injured "very quickly", with the NSW opposition saying it raises doubts over why the word "taser" was omitted from a press release.

title.children: Emails show timeline of police contact with Clare Nowland's family after alleged tasering

image.altText: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu speaks during a press conference.

props.synopsis: If all goes to plan, guns in and around Gaza are set to fall silent as Israeli hostages and Palestinian prisoners are released and aid is delivered. Even in the darkness of this war, four parties can make an agreement, writes John Lyons.

title.children: Even in the darkness of this war, four parties can make an agreement

image.altText: A young man holding a film camera.

props.synopsis: Family and friends of 30-year-old camera operator James Rose and 56-year-old pilot Stephen Gale pay tribute to the two men, as authorities continue to investigate the cause of Sunday's mid-air plane crash over Melbourne's Port Phillip bay.

title.children: Family mourns 'one of a kind' camera operator after plane crash remains found by police

image.altText: Picture from the ground looking up at a high-voltage transmission tower, with wind turbines in the background

props.synopsis: With the clock ticking on efforts to more than double Australia's renewable energy share by 2030, sources tell the ABC that the government commissioned a secret review of its renewable energy target to see whether it could hit the ambitious goal.

title.children: Federal Labor commissions secret review into green energy target as pressure mounts over feasibility, sources reveal

image.altText: Seismic survey

props.synopsis: While oil and gas companies argue no lasting harm is done by undersea blasting, Tasmanian fisherman Danny Fox isn't so sure — and says if it's so harmless, he'd like to see an "oil executive" in a bath take a large blast of compressed air to "see what he thinks".

title.children: This stretch of water is a way of life for fishers and tourists – but it's also a hotspot for multinationals to drill and blast

image.altText: A man sitting indoors in a suit jacket speaks and gestures with his hands

props.synopsis: Sam Altman says he is returning to OpenAI after being fired by the company and joining Microsoft only days ago.

title.children: Sam Altman to return as OpenAI CEO days after being fired and joining Microsoft

image.altText: a man in a check blue and yellow shirt speaking to media

props.synopsis: Clive Palmer has lost a more than three-year legal battle with the Gold Coast City Council, which would have seen 3,000 new dwellings built next to a sewage treatment plant.

title.children: Judge dismisses Clive Palmer's appeal to build thousands of homes on floodplain near sewage treatment plant

image.altText: A dated image of a happy smiling woman.

props.synopsis: A Perth court has been told a 77-year-old man will maintain he is innocent of murdering a woman who vanished in Perth almost 40 years ago.

title.children: Man charged with 1986 murder of Perth mother Sharon Fulton says he will fight charge

image.altText: Clare O'Neil looks towards Anthony Albanese at a joint press conference in the Prime Minister's courtyard at Parliament House.

props.synopsis: It took just 14 words from Home Affairs Minister Clare O'Neil for ears to prick up. Innocuous to many, they were shocking to those in the know and again left Labor having to correct the record, writes Brett Worthington.

title.children: The 14 words that caused Clare O'Neil a whole lot of pain

image.altText: A smiling man sitting on the rung of a helicopter in grassland, wearing a trucker cap and bright blue ag worker shirt.

props.synopsis: In its report, the ATSB found the helicopter likely crashed because of fuel exhaustion resulting in engine stoppage.

title.children: ATSB releases final report into chopper crash that killed Netflix star Chris 'Willow' Wilson

subjects.title: Air and Space Accidents and Incidents

image.altText: A man with a grey beard and black cap and a blonde woman resting her hand on his shoulder smile in a radio studio.

props.synopsis: A deal signed by the hosts of The Kyle and Jackie O Show will also see Sydney's top-rating radio breakfast program broadcast in Melbourne from 2024, and follows their employer launching a takeover bid of their former network.

title.children: 'Love us or loathe us': Kyle Sandilands and Jackie O ink 'historic' 10-year radio deal worth $200 million

image.altText: Soldiers with an MNDAA flag pose for a photo in front of a bridge.

props.synopsis: An "unprecedented" surprise offensive launched by a coalition of ethnic-based armies and pro-democracy fighters in Myanmar's north has some observers convinced the country's ruling junta is likely to be defeated.

title.children: Following an 'unprecedented' combined rebel offensive, could the Myanmar military government's days be numbered?

image.altText: A hooded man holds a laptop computer as cyber code is projected on him in this illustration picture

props.synopsis: Australian officials are increasingly worried about the Pacific's vulnerability to cyber attacks, with the government spending $26 million to set up "rapid assistance" teams made up of experts from the private sector and specialists from intelligence agencies like the Australian Signals Directorate.

title.children: Australia to deploy roving teams of cyber experts across Pacific as online threats grow

image.altText: Faisal holds a banner calling for help while his wife and children stand with him

props.synopsis: Men who spent years in detention on Manus Island living in the hope of resettlement now face being evicted from their temporary homes.

title.children: These refugees were detained for years on Manus Island. Now they're caught between three countries

image.altText: A black and white photo of The Cruel Sea

props.synopsis: The frontman on joining his favourite band, playing Daytona with Mick Jagger, and that missing ARIA story.

title.children: 'We weren't sure it would ever happen': Tex Perkins on The Cruel Sea's first reunion in over a decade

image.altText: Israeli tanks operate in Gaza.

props.synopsis: Israel's government has voted to back a deal to secure the release of some of the hostages held in Gaza over four days where there will be a "pause in fighting".

title.children: 150 Palestinians held in Israeli jails to be released in ceasefire deal

image.altText: A soccer player wearing blue and yellow takes a photo with her girlfriend after a match

props.synopsis: After months of speculation, Matildas star Sam Kerr shares photos from the moment she proposed to her long-term girlfriend, American professional soccer player Kristie Mewis.

title.children: Matildas star Sam Kerr shares glimpse of the moment she proposed to partner Kristie Mewis

image.altText: A hand holding a credit card out towards a recipient.

props.synopsis: The Australian Bureau of Statistics survey finds around 16 per cent of women have experienced some form of economic abuse. A leading women's advocate says it's a form of abuse that too often is flying under the radar.

title.children: Linda's relationship 'didn't feel bad enough to leave' — but she was experiencing economic abuse

image.altText: A close up of a hand holding a mobile phone, which is displaying an apology to customers written on the Optus website.

props.synopsis: Submissions to a Senate inquiry outline what happened behind the scenes as Optus rushed to fix its recent outage.

title.children: Urgent meetings, router resets and 400 workers: Behind the scenes of the Optus outage

image.altText: An Aboriginal man wearing a cap holds a small painting

props.synopsis: Groote Eylandt's Indigenous communities celebrate the return of 174 artefacts from the Manchester Museum, saying the move has encouraged them to start making and using them again.

title.children: 'Special day' as artefacts collected from Groote Eylandt 70 years ago returned to Anindilyakwa

image.altText: A split image showing two young heat-exhausted women and the pop star Taylor Swift performing.

props.synopsis: The heat index – or "feels like" – temperature reportedly reached 59C in Rio de Janeiro as thousands of fans queued up for Taylor Swift's performance.

title.children: The heat was brutal at Taylor Swift's tragic Rio concert. One factor made it even more dangerous
